revised_title: Huggins Constant of Dilute Polymer Solutions: A New Approach
tldr: The authors developed a new method to calculate the Huggins constant for dilute polymer solutions, based on the random coil model of polymer molecules. They found that the Huggins constant is related to its value at the theta-point, which is a critical point in polymer solutions. This new approach provides a better understanding of the concentration dependence of the relaxation spectrum and the viscosity equation in polymer solutions.
